private_information: I am the actor performing actions from the available action set: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with their parameter patterns.

Action schemas summary: paltry(A,B,C) requires hand A, cats B, texture C, vase A B, next B C and yields next A C and removes vase A B. sip(A,B,C) requires hand A, cats B, texture C, next A C, next B C and yields vase A B and deletes next A C. clip(A,B,C) requires hand A, sneeze B, texture C, next B C, next A C and yields vase A B and deletes next A C. wretched(A,B,C,D) requires sneeze A, texture B, texture C, stupendous D, next A B, collect B D, collect C D and yields next A C and deletes next A B. memory(A,B,C) requires cats A, spring B, spring C, next A B and yields next A C and deletes next A B. tightfisted(A,B,C) requires hand A, sneeze B, texture C, next B C, vase A B and yields next A C and deletes vase A B.

I have an intended concrete plan consisting of a sequence of ground actions in a particular order that I will execute against the initial facts to try to reach the goal. The plan is provided as a list of ground actions and their arguments.
player.goal: Execute and document the intended plan by mapping each plan step to its preconditions and effects and reporting any steps that violate preconditions given the initial facts.

private_information: I hold the two different initial condition statements and two target goals given in the use-case description and I can simulate state updates using the action schema effects.

Initial facts include many ground predicates such as cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, sneeze facts, spring facts, stupendous object_2 and object_3, texture facts, and various next relations. The use-case also contains two variant statement blocks with slightly different initial next facts and two slightly different goals.

I will verify whether the provided plan is applicable from the initial facts and whether it achieves the stated goal, and I will produce a stepwise state trace and a concise report of mismatches or unresolved references.
validator.goal: Simulate and validate the ground plan against the provided initial facts and report the resulting state trace and whether the goal is achieved.

private_information: I coordinate the information from the player and the validator and must produce a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner.

I must keep agent actions distinct if needed and preserve the original action names and parameter roles when encoding the PDDL domain. The PDDL problem must include all relevant objects, initial facts derived from the chosen initial statement, and the final goal facts.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the analyses and verification outputs to produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that models the described action schemas, initial facts, objects, and the final goal.

public_information: There is a set of named objects object_0 through object_13 and beyond used by the actions.
Available ground predicates include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, collect, sneeze, spring, stupendous.
Action names and their intended parameter patterns are: paltry(A,B,C), sip(A,B,C), clip(A,B,C), wretched(A,B,C,D), memory(A,B,C), tightfisted(A,B,C).
Actions have explicit preconditions and deterministic add and delete effects as described by the use-case.
Two variant initial condition blocks and corresponding goals are provided; the orchestrator must choose and encode the one to target in the final PDDL problem.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the player agent. Your role is to analyze the concrete plan provided in the use-case and map each ground action to its schema preconditions and effects using the action schemas known to you. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a concise machine-readable analysis that lists for each plan step: the ground action, the required preconditions (ground predicates), the add effects (ground predicates) and the delete effects (ground predicates), and flag any step that appears to lack required preconditions given the initial facts summary.
analyze.prompt: Your name is player. You are given the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->player->private_information}. Your objective is {agents->player->goal}. Take the concrete plan from the use-case and for each ground action produce a single-line structured entry describing its preconditions, add effects and delete effects and whether the step is applicable given the initial facts summary. Do not output PDDL nor assume facts that are not present in the initial summaries.

verify.system_prompt: You are the validator agent. Your role is to simulate the concrete plan step by step starting from the provided initial facts, applying action effects as described by the schemas. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a compact state trace after each step, list any failed preconditions or absent predicates, and state whether the chosen goal is achieved at the end.
verify.prompt: Your name is validator. You see the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->validator->private_information}. Your objective is {agents->validator->goal}. Simulate the provided plan against the initial facts, produce the state after each action application, and report success or failure in achieving the goal. If there are ambiguities or missing facts for simulation, report them explicitly.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and must produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem formatted for use with the FastDownwards planner. You must encode the action schemas paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory and tightfisted preserving the parameter roles and the deterministic add and delete effects. Include a typing section if useful. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the final PDDL uses constructs supported by FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. You will receive two inputs: the analysis from the player ({player_analysis}) and the simulation report from the validator ({validator_report}). Your objective is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the agents' outputs to produce a coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that model the described predicates, objects, initial facts (choose the appropriate initial statement variant as you document), and the stated goal variant. Keep action names and parameter ordering consistent with the use-case. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
